general_advisory: Rainfall is expected during next five days, spray only when sky becomes clear and use sticker to the spray solution. Farmers are advised to do proper arrangement for storing rainwater at one portion in the field. Make proper drainage system in non-paddy crop field for removing of excess water. Due to high humidity, possibilities of pest and disease build up in already sown crops. Take plant protection measures depending on the crop and weather condition.

advisory: Keep the rice plots weed free.
Apply low quantity of Nitrogen fertilizer to reduce the blast disease.
Spray chlorantraniliprole @ 6 ml /15 liter of water to control the steam borer.
Spray Imidachloprid @ 0.6 ml / liter of water to control the BPH.
Complete the transplanting. Use 4 -5 seedlings / hill in age old seedlings with closed spacing.
Develop better drainage system to avoid waterlogging condition due to excess rainfall.
Root and stalk rot may observe in maize field, to control it spray Validamycin 3% L @ 2 ml/litre of water or Carbendazim 50% WP @ 1.5 g/litre of water.
Fall army worm may observe in field, to control it spray Emamectin benzoate 5% SG @ 0.4 g/litre of water or Chlorantraniliprole 18.5% SC @ 0.4 ml/Iitre of water.

Prepare the field and raise Kharif groundnut of high yielding varieties. Treat the seeds with Trichoderma viridae (10 gm.), Pseudomonas fluorescence (10 gm.) and Rhizobium culture (20 gm.) per kg of seed before sowing.
Condition is favorable for blast incidence in ragi, if observed spray Zineb 75% WP @ 2 g/litre of water or Tricyclazole 75% WP @ 1 g/litre of water when the sky becomes clear.
Transplant 25-35 days old seedlings in the main field.
Make necessary drainage channels to prevent waterlogging condition.
Identify and fill gaps in the main field to maintain plant population.
Wilting in brinjal can be managed by spraying Tabuconazole @ 1 g/lt.
There is a chance of downy mildew attack in cucumber. If observed, spray Metalaxyl 8% + Mancozeb 64% @ 2 g/litre of water on sunny days.
Go for weeding and apply 54 kg urea per acre at 45 days after planting and apply mulching @ 2 t/acre.
To manage soft rot disease of ginger, apply Tagmycin @ 1.5 packets or Neem oil @ 75ml per 15ltr barrel tank sprayer.
Bacterial wilt Once noticed in the field all beds should be drenched with Bordeaux mixture 1% or copper oxychloride 0.2%.

If Leaf gall and thrips occurs, spray Monocrotophos 36 WSC 1.5 ml/lit or Dimethoate 30 EC @ 2 ml/lit or Chlorpyriphos 2 ml/lit or neem oil 3% (30ml/lit) three rounds at monthly intervals starting from new flush formation.
Go for weeding and apply 26 kg urea per acre at 45 days after planting and apply mulching @ 2 t/acre.
To manage Rhizome rot disease of turmeric, apply Tagmycin @ 1.5 packets or Neem oil @ 75ml per 15ltr barrel tank sprayer.
Stem borer management
Maintain/creating optimum shade
Borer infested plants should be thoroughly traced, uprooted burnt to avoid economic loss during subsequent years.
Installation of pheromone traps @ 25 /ha, if the incidence is high.
Pad with chlorpyriphos 25% EC @ 5 ml by making a window in the stem at 5 cm x 5 cm and fill it with absorbent cotton dipped in insecticide solution and close it.
Keep dry fodder and straw ready at home for sheep and goat in rainy season and ensure the practice of flushing to give balanced concentrate to sheep and goat one month prior to kidding and lambing.
Please ensure filling of holes and crevices of poultry house in rainy days otherwise that will facilitate the entry of snakes and reptiles, which may kill the birds.
